name: The St. Regis Doha

reviews.text: I stayed for 5 days at the St Regis Doha. With the St Regis branding, you would and should expect a certain level of service, excellence in facilities and that "X or wow factor". Sadly, this hotel is lacking in most of these attributes and I'll tell you why.
reviews.title: A grand hotel but needs a a great deal of improvements

reviews.text: Firstly the pros and where the hotel does indeed excel. Huge, grand, and lavish lobby, spotlessly clean and well maintained common areas. The ground floor was clearly designed to impress even the most discerning traveller, and of course sufficiently ostentatious to even impress the many Arab royalties who do frequent this address. The hotel boasts about 6 restaurants, though not all are open all day or for all meals. The two Gordon Ramsey restaurants within the hotel were certainly not as impressive as I hoped for. The Chinese inspired restaurant - Hakkasan was much better and more lively in atmosphere. Breakfast in the hotel main restaurant (Vine) was just average, with a rather limited selection of local and international food.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gym was huge by most hotel standards with all the latest modern equipment you would need and the pool is magnificent - just about Olympic size! There is also a private but very small beach front area and the hotel does have some stunning views of the city skyline and of the new development called "The Pearl".
reviews.title: Nice Design cheap finishing

reviews.text: Now to the cons and where vast improvements need to be made. Firstly, the facility itself. For a relatively new hotel, I was surprised to see so much wear and tear already quite apparent. In my room for eg (room 206), parts of the walls were discoloured from leakages I believe, and the floor carpet was not well maintained. The room design looked a bit dated. Even though the hotel opened officially in May 2012, you get the feeling that its "been around" much longer. I anticipate this to worsen and hence I think the management needs to pay greater attention to the standard of maintenance and housekeeping.
reviews.title: Happy to recommend

reviews.text: Location wise, this hotel is really "in the middle of nowhere". Perhaps in a few years time, when the new developments have been done up, this hotel might be considered one that is well located. You need to take a 30 minute or so taxi ride to the city centre and to all the tourist attractions.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel and perfect service

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of staying at the St Regis, Doha for a week whilst attending a conference, on the company's dollar. It is an amazing place with some exceptional features. The lobby is inspiring, the rooms very well appointed.
reviews.title: Amazing
Friday brunch
reviews.text: The food at each of the restaurants was excellent and the Vine restaurant serving a very good buffet each day with food that satisfied and beyond.

A couple of cons - the staffing in the Vine and other areas of the hotel were erratic. The lobby has about 30 people all standing to take bags and open doors, yet the reception desk and concierge always has queues. The restaurants are massive yet have only one or two servers, resulting in lots of hand waving and consternation. Same for the room services - asking for ice or bags to be collected took over ten mins for someone to come, when there were about 15 porters in the lobby.
reviews.title: Finest experience @ the Finest Address
Not what I expected
reviews.text: The provision of a personal butler was amazing and I was tended to like a king, but information was sparse as to his duties, if I was paying for it (not my money and therefore a little timid) and this went for much of the hotel - information was not exactly free flowing.

The room lighting is the strangest I have seen. Various settings for various moods - cool. But, when you go from the room into the bathroom, turning on the bathroom lights plunges the bedroom into darkness. Fine for me as I was solo, but what if your partner was in there. Very strange!
reviews.title: Outstanding service!

reviews.text: i was stay around 5 days in this hotel, really i like them, every thing there was perfect, alike views, services, reception, food, and staff people, they make you as VIP.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: also the hotel has a good location, near from Katara (the culture destination in Doha) near by from malls and airport also city center.
reviews.title: More than perfect

reviews.text: Thanks a lot for the hotel management, and each person how working in this hotel.
reviews.title: Most likely the best hotel in Doha, Qatar.

reviews.text: Ghassan Kharoub
reviews.title: Worst B-Day ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was here for a industry conference and stayed for 2 nights. It is a highly customer oriented hotel. Staff is always helpful and positive. Rooms are very luxurious and has more than everything you need. Plenty of restaurants among which you can choose as you desire. It was a perfect stay and recommend to anyone considering it.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I had a great time in my last Business trip to Doha, my stay in St, Regis was a great experience, the staff were so friendly and helpful, especially n the Vintage Bar, Kris the bar tender, AJ and the all the rest.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: I had a fantastic experience at SaraB Lounge Cafe. The atmosphere was very relaxing with a nice music. It was Christmas Season and the hotel had a huge Christmas tree and a delicious Gingerbread house. The waiter (Janyla Mamasheva) was so kind and attentive, she told me about the program of festivities in the hotel. The tea and caked were absolutely delicious. All the stuff was very polite and very responsive, I felt like they were my friends. I felt very welcome at this hotel and enjoyed my evening a lot.
reviews.title: SaraB Lounge Tea Experience

reviews.text: I travel frequently for work and was a guest at the St. Regis in November- I had two trips to Qatar that month. My first, I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Sharq Village (one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had- very attentive staff, everyone used my name, everyone went above and beyond)... I returned a week later and stayed at the St Regis for a wedding at the hotel that I was invited to, and had a very disappointing stay. The doors for the rooms don’t close behind you so one day I returned to my room in the afternoon and my door was not closed- when I called to speak with the Manager, it was as if they didn’t care. The managers response was 'well is anything missing?' with no apology. I later had a hair and manicure appointment at the salon at 6pm. I arrived at 6, and they didn’t see me until 7. I reminded them about 8 times that I also needed a manicure. By the time they finished my hair, they still had not started with my nails. As I was late to the wedding, as they started doing my hair an hour after my appointment was scheduled for, I had to leave for the wedding and never had my manicure. Both evenings there was noise/construction going on outside until 4AM. The day I left, I had ordered room service. I waited an hour and it never came- I then had to check out so that I would not miss my flight. My colleague that was also staying at the hotel with me complained about the construction noise and the doors not closing well. Overall, I was very disappointed. A hotel of this caliber should not have this many problems. My next stay, I will return to the Ritz-Carlton Sharq Village where the employees genuinely care about the guest and the guests experience.
reviews.title: Not quite polished...

reviews.text: Stayed at St Regis on a business trip. Was an excellent stay. Butler service very convenient and surroundings while luxurious but not very spacious. Would have liked The reception to have a bigger seating area.
reviews.title: Luxury

reviews.text: Bathrooms were great. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

description: Located on the shores of Doha’s glittering West Bay, the St. Regis Doha is a five-star luxury hotel with 336 guest rooms including 70 seductive suites, aiming to set new standards of luxury service & excellence with the signature St. Regis Butler Service.The hotel introduces a collection of ten signature restaurants & bars, extensive recreation facilities including world-acclaimed Remède Spa. The St. Regis Doha is the finest address for leisure & business travelers in Doha
